N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 383-5.6 - Termination of permit after the institutional control period

State Regulations
(a) At the conclusion of the institutional
control period, the permittee may apply for termination of the
permit. (b) An application for
termination must contain the following: (1)
a
demonstration that without institutional control, there is reasonable assurance
that the disposal facility will meet the performance objectives. The
demonstration must include technical analyses that meet the requirements of
section
383-3.4
(h)(2)
of
this Part; (2)
proof that a
declaration of restrictions or other approved document has been filed with the
county clerk of the county where the land disposal facility is located as
required by section
383-9.4
(k)(1)
of
this Part; (3)
an assessment of
current local land use and how it differs from that during the permitting of
the land disposal facility and the effect of those differences on the land
disposal facility's ability to meet the performance objectives; (4)
an assessment of the current and future
doses to the general public due to releases from the land disposal facility
based on the actual inventory of waste in the land disposal facility, the
radioactive decay that has occurred since the waste was disposed of, the
results of the monitoring performed pursuant to Subpart 383-10 of this Part, and any remediation or maintenance that has been undertaken; and
(5)
a plot plan showing the location of all
disposal units, markers, and any remaining associated facilities, referenced to
the site grid system required by section
383-11.2
(c) of
this Part. (c) The
department may terminate the permit upon a finding that: (1)
the institutional control requirements of

Subpart 383-9 of this Part and all requirements of the permit as modified
pursuant to section
383-5.5
of this Subpart have been
met; (2)
in the absence of
institutional control there is reasonable assurance that the performance
objectives will be met; (3)
any
additional requirements resulting from new information developed during the
institutional control period have been met; (4)
permanent markers warning against
intrusion have been installed; and
(5)
the applicable requirements of Part 617
of this Title have been met. Notes
